perturbation.original_text:
LIMITATION OF LIABILITY

i-on will not be liable under any circumstances for any lost profits or other consequential damages, even if i-on has been advised as to the possibility of such damages. i-on's liability for damages to the Customer for any cause whatsoever, regardless of the form of action, and whether in contract or in tort, including negligence, shall be limited to one (1) month's fees and the remaining portion of any prepaid fees.
perturbation.changed_text:
MISCELLANEOUS

i-on will not be liable under any circumstances for any lost profits or other consequential damages, even if i-on has been advised as to the possibility of such damages. i-on's liability for damages to the Customer for any cause whatsoever, regardless of the form of action, and whether in contract or in tort, including negligence, shall be limited to one (1) month's fees and the remaining portion of any prepaid fees.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the limitation of liability clause to the 'Miscellaneous' section obscures its importance and makes it less likely to be noticed by the Customer. Liability clauses are generally expected to be in their own clearly labeled section.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law Principles Regarding Conspicuousness of Liability Limitations
